source_sentence: 般若守護十六善神王形體
translation: Prajñāpāramitā-śubha in the form of sixteen good deity kings
Vajraśekhara Tripiṭaka Translation

source_sentence: 提頭攞宅善神　綠青色。
translation: Dhṛtarāṣṭra, a good deity, is greenish-blue in color.
He opens his mouth and assumes a wrathful appearance.
He's wearing armor and a red robe.
He holds a large sword in his right hand and a spear in his left hand.
In his left hand, he holds a spear.
His hair is purple.

source_sentence: 毘盧勒叉善神　赤紫色。
translation: He's a red-violet Vairocana good god.
He's wrathful and has the shape of a closed lip.
He draws a folding spear with his right hand.
He holds his left armor at his waist.
He's wearing armor and a white-and-bright blue robe.
His hair on his eyebrows is violet.

source_sentence: 摧伏毒害善神　鬢聳立弭也。
translation: He subdues poisonous and harmful good spirits. His eyebrows are standing straight up.
They're red and flesh-colored.
He holds a large sword in his right hand.
He points his left hand outward at his chest.

source_sentence: 被甲冑著白色衣服餘如常。
translation: He's wearing armor and a white robe, but the rest is as usual.
He's a good spirit who enhances others. He's red-fleshed.
He has four arms and an angry demon in his midst.
The first hand on his right holds a large sword.
In the second hand, he holds a wheel of swords.
The first one on the left holds a willow twig.
In the second hand, he holds a half-moon.
He wears a robe that's green in color.
His robe is red and his necklace is necklace-ornamented.
He's a joyful, good-looking god in green.
There's a peacock on his head.
Its color is gold.
He holds a hook in his right hand.
With his left hand, he holds it at his waist.
He's wearing armor and a red robe.
His eyebrows are the color of tan, and his hair is white.
His face is wrathful in substance.

source_sentence: 除一切障難善神　黃色。
translation: He's a good deity who removes all obstacles and hindrances. He's yellow in color.
He's angrily displeased.
He wears bright white clothing on his six arms.
In his right hand, he holds a three-pronged halberd.
In the next hand, he holds a scripture.
In the next hand, he holds a jeweled stūpa of a relic.
In his left hand, he holds a red lotus.
In the next hand, he holds a jeweled hook.
In the next hand, he holds a jeweled conch.
He wears a jeweled crown and reddish-brown robe.
He blows the wind of his celestial robe.
He wears a necklace and bracelets as usual.

source_sentence: 拔除罪垢善神　裸形被赤綠色袈裟。
translation: The good deity who removes the stain of sin is naked and covered with a red-green robe.
His hair stands on end.
He's also red and yellow in color.
In his right hand, he holds a staff.
His staff has five prongs.
He makes a fist with his left hand and puts it on top of his head.
His eyes are angrily opened, and his mouth is opened.
Sharp teeth are protruding from above and below.
He's very frightening.
He's a charismatic god of patience and emptiness.
He holds a large sword in his right hand and a lance in his left.
In his left hand, he holds a lance.
He wears a scarf on his head.

source_sentence: 其色白下至腂纔見冑端。
translation: His color is white, and he can be seen from the tip of his helmet down to his heels.

source_sentence: 鬢髮紫也(已上右方立之)。
translation: His hair on his eyebrows is purple (he's standing to the right of the above).

source_sentence: 吠室羅摩拏善神　青黑色。
translation: Vaiśravaṇa is a good deity, blue and black.
He shows the characteristic of an angry king.
He makes a face with his lips closed.
In his right hand, he holds a vajra spear.
In his left hand, he holds a full-body Śāriputra pagoda.
He's wearing armor and a red robe.
His hair on his eyebrows is purple.

source_sentence: 毘盧博叉善神　肉色。
translation: He's a flesh-colored Vairocana good god.
He hangs his arm in black silk.
He makes a writing gesture with a brush.
He's wearing armor and a green robe.
His hair on his eyebrows is red in color.
He's in the form of a smiling man.

source_sentence: 離一切怖畏神　形體如帝釋天。
translation: He's a god free of all fears whose body resembles that of Śakra Devānām-Indra.
He's just got a skull on top of his head.
On top of that skull is a three-pronged form.

source_sentence: 救護一切善神　青白色。
translation: A god who protects all that's good. He's blue and white.
His appearance is like that of Vaiśravaṇa.
His left and right hands are joined at the palms.

source_sentence: 十指端有紅色微敷蓮華。
translation: At the end of his ten fingers, there's a red lotus subtly decorated with red flowers.
His clothing is red and yellow.

source_sentence: 攝伏諸魔善神　髮毛聳立。
translation: He's a good deity who subdues Māra and has hair standing on end.
They're black and flesh-colored.
His features are adorned with a necklace.
He holds a sword in his right hand.
With his left hand, he points his lower palm outward.
His clothing is yellow.

source_sentence: 能救諸有善神　白綠色顏貌玉相也。
translation: He's capable of saving all the good spirits in his life. He has a white-green face and jade features.

source_sentence: 二手虛心合掌屈二頭指。
translation: He closes his palms with his second hand and bends his two forefingers.
He attaches the first syllable to the back of his middle finger.
He's wearing a white robe on his jacket.
His robe is red in color.

source_sentence: 師子威猛善神　肉色戴師子寶冠。
translation: He's a flesh-colored lion wearing a lion's crown of treasures.
The first one on the right holds an axe.
The second one holds a sword.
The first on his left holds a palm-leaf scripture.
The second is holding a trident.
He's wearing a monk's robe that's deep and violet in color.
He's wearing a small robe and the skin of a tiger.
He's extremely angry.

source_sentence: 勇猛心地善神　被甲冑綠色。
translation: He's a brave, mindful, and good spirit wearing armor and a green helmet.
He's like a being who can save all sentient beings.
He's wearing a hand-over-hand fetter on his chest.

source_sentence: 微笑之相也(已上左方立之)。
translation: It's a smiling face (already shown above on the left).
The original Ao says.

source_sentence: 又陀羅尼集經第三卷說十六善神名字并總呪。
translation: "The third volume of the Dhāraṇī Collection Sutra explains the names of 16 good spirits and the general dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 又如空比丘夢感自塔院律師之(已上)。
translation: Rukong Bijuju's dream inspired him to lecture at the stūpa (ibid.).
Gu-ring ji viii: "There is a worldly translator of the Prajñāpāramitā by Vajrajña.

source_sentence: 世有金剛智所譯般若守護十六善神一卷三紙。
translation: "There is a translation by Vajrajña that guards the sixteen good spirits in a single three-page volume.

source_sentence: 讀之明知非是金剛智筆語。
translation: When he reads it, he clearly knows that it's not written by Vajrajñāpāramitā.
The textual embellishments are very clumsy.

source_sentence: 想先達依金剛智圖畫錄之。
translation: It's thought that the pioneer recorded it based on Vajrajñāpāramitā's drawings.
He had assumed the name Vajrajñāpāramitā.
He didn't fathom it very well.

source_sentence: 今謂於翻譯席設譯語筆授證義綴文等職。
translation: Now, it's called the translation chair, which is established to translate words, write, confer, realize meaning, embellish text, and so forth.
It's a translation of Sanskrit into Chinese.
It mustn't be one of the translator's hands.
Instead, there's a second remedy and an unmediated one.
Only the penetration of meaning is its strength.
How could it be based on textual ornamentation?

source_sentence: 今歲得一本於智積院方丈。
translation: This year, I obtained a copy of the text at the abbot of Zhigye Institute.
It was printed from the Xiaochibang Canon.

source_sentence: 時享和二壬戌年仲夏月。
translation: It was the middle month of summer in the year henghe byeok nyang.

source_sentence: 豐山長谷輪下沙門　快道　誌　　　　　　　　　　一校了　慈順　文政三年庚辰仲秋晦日。
translation: Bong san changgu lunxia shaman kaito chi yisshun cisshun wenzheng san gengchen mid-autumn late-day.

source_sentence: 右以秀陽闍梨令密榮挍之本亦　一校了。
translation: The right hand side of the text was made by the Xuyang Jiali order Mireong, and the right hand side was also made by the first proof-reading.
Nāgârjuna
